question_sentence: The CEO of which messaging app was arrested by French police as he disembarked from a private jet?
evidence: Pavel Durov has been charged with complicity in an array of crimes allegedly facilitated by the messaging app in what is shaping up to be a landmark case in the legal responsibility of tech bosses for content shared on their platforms.

question_sentence: A four-year-old accidentally smashed a 3,500-year-old jar during a trip to which museum?
evidence: The rare Bronze Age artefact, dated between 2200BC and 1500BC, was accidentally shattered when a curious boy pulled the jar to see inside. The Hecht Museum, in Haifa, Israel, will continue to display its artefacts as usual, and the family has been invited back once the jar is restored.

question_sentence: Which video game, China's first AAA+ blockbuster, has topped Steam's "most-played" chart?
evidence: The action-adventure game, based on a 16th-century epic, has been widely acclaimed, despite a negative backlash to the game's marketing team's attempt to bar gaming journalists from mentioning topics including Covid-19 and "feminist propaganda" in their reviews.

question_sentence: According to his biographer, Keir Starmer has had a portrait of which former prime minister removed from 10 Downing Street?
evidence: The decision to take down the painting has been criticised by some in the Conservative Party. Greg Smith, the MP for Mid Buckinghamshire, told The Telegraph the decision was “utter pettiness from Starmer”.

question_sentence: Pacific Island leaders met for an annual summit in which nation's capital?
evidence: The 53rd Pacific Island Forum comes at a moment of "polycrisis" for the region, warned Fijian Prime Minister Sitiveni Rabuka. The low-lying island nations are on the frontline of climate change, and also at the centre of a geopolitical tug of war between China and the West.

question_sentence: Which TV series about a podcast is returning for a fourth series?
evidence: The show follows a trio of true crime podcasters and neighbours – Charles (Steve Martin), Oliver (Martin Short) and Mabel (Selena Gomez) – who solve mysteries in their swanky New York apartment complex.

question_sentence: The UK's National Crime Agency has warned of a surge in attempts to smuggle which drug into the country?
evidence: Border agents have intercepted 15 tonnes of cannabis at UK airports so far this year, compared to five tonnes in the whole of 2023. The National Crime Agency says most of the haul comes from countries where recreational marijuana is legal, the majority from the US. Find out more on this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: What was the main target of Russia's recent missile and drone attacks on Ukraine?
evidence: Russia's attack, involving 236 cruise and supersonic missiles targeting Kyiv’s energy infrastructure, was the largest aerial assault to date, exceeding its previous record of 158 missiles and drones in a single day. However, Ukraine successfully intercepted or disabled 201 of those missiles.

question_sentence: Former MP Dominic Grieve is the latest contender to enter the race for which largely ceremonial position?
evidence: Grieve's competition for the ancient post includes former international cricket star Imran Khan, who will be running from his prison cell following a string of legal entanglements since being removed as prime minister of Pakistan in 2022.

question_sentence: Wildlife officials in Missouri found a bald eagle unable to fly for what reason?
evidence: Veterinarians from the Dickerson Park Zoo examined the flightless bird, initially expecting to find a broken wing. Instead, an X-ray revealed a raccoon's leg and paw in its stomach. The eagle was healthy but overly full from the raccoon and was quickly released after a brief stay at the hospital.

question_sentence: The race for the White House is entering its final stretch with Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump targeting battleground states. How many electoral votes are needed to win the November presidential election?
evidence: It takes at least 270 electoral votes to win the presidency. There are a total of 538 electoral votes up for grabs.

question_sentence: Flash flooding in which US national park recently prompted the rescues of more than 100 people?
evidence: Flash flooding triggered by monsoon storms forced local authorities to shut down Grand Canyon National Park to tourists and prompted several emergency evacuations. One hiker was killed.

question_sentence: Walmart this week recalled nearly 10,000 cases of which type of juice?
evidence: Walmart recalled nearly 10,000 cases of apple juice sold in 25 states that were found to contain potentially harmful levels of inorganic arsenic.

question_sentence: The jersey that New York Yankees legend Babe Ruth wore when he hit one of baseball’s most famous home runs recently sold at auction for how much?
evidence: Babe Ruth's "Called Shot" home run is one of baseball's most famous moments, and the jersey he wore at the time sold for $24 million — making it the world’s most valuable sports collectible.

question_sentence: According to new data from aviation analytics firm Cirium, which of the following ranks as the airport with the most connections worldwide?
evidence: IGA Istanbul Airport, which opened just six years ago in 2018, operates an impressive 309 nonstop flights to destinations around the world. Most of those are with Turkish Airlines, which serves more countries than any other airline.

question_sentence: Which famous duo signed a $100 million podcast deal this week?
evidence: Brothers and NFL stars Jason and Travis Kelce signed a $100 million deal with Amazon’s podcast studio Wondery for their “New Heights with Jason & Travis Kelce” podcast.

question_sentence: Yelp filed an antitrust lawsuit against which tech giant this week?
evidence: Yelp filed an antitrust lawsuit against Google, alleging it used its monopoly to dominate local search and advertising markets.

question_sentence: Millions of people were urged to evacuate southern Japan this week as a result of which event?
evidence: Nearly 4 million people in southern Japan were urged to evacuate as Typhoon Shanshan made landfall Thursday, leaving thousands of residents without power and lashing Kyushu Island with hurricane-force winds, torrential rain and dangerous storm surge.

question_sentence: The Supreme Court declined this week to lift a sweeping block on which of President Joe Biden’s signature initiatives?
evidence: The Supreme Court declined on Wednesday to lift a sweeping block on President Biden’s student loan repayment plan that aims to slash monthly payments and accelerate the path to loan forgiveness.

question_sentence: Which city outside the US is the top Labor Day weekend destination, according to AAA?
evidence: AAA says the No. 1 Labor Day weekend destination for Americans outside the US will be Vancouver, British Columbia, followed by a quartet of European favorites: Rome, London, Paris and Dublin.

question_sentence: What is the name of the first new school in Wilmington in 50 years?
What is the primary reason for demolishing the Chick-fil-A at Governor’s Square in Bear, Delaware?
choices: The building is too old and needs to be replaced.
The location will be converted into a different type of restaurant.
The current layout causes traffic jams during peak times.

question_sentence: What was the primary reason for the closure of Stitch House Brewing in Wilmington?
choices: It was sold to the owners of Bardea Food & Drink.
The brewery was relocating to a new location.

question_sentence: What is one of the measures being implemented in Delaware schools to reduce cellphone distractions during the school day?
choices: Banning cellphones entirely from school premises
Allowing cellphones only during lunch breaks
Requiring students to turn off their phones and leave them at home

question_sentence: What was the final score of the Delaware State vs. Hawaii football game?
Which player is competing with Tanner McKee for the backup quarterback position on the Philadelphia Eagles?
When is the new Target store in Middletown, Delaware, expected to open?
What is the main reason for the closure of Govatos Chocolates in Delaware?
choices: The business is relocating to a new state.
The shop is merging with another chocolate company.
The business is shifting to an online-only model.

question_sentence: What is the legal status of transporting marijuana across state lines from Delaware?
choices: It is legal if you have a medical marijuana card.
It is illegal under federal law.
It is allowed if the amount is less than one ounce.

question_sentence: What is one of the key reasons the Delaware Blue Hens expect to have a stronger defense this season?
choices: They have a new head coach.
They have recruited several new offensive players.
They have changed their home stadium.
